primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God subjects all of humanity to the state of disobedience/judgment so that He may unilaterally exercise mercy upon them through Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all men to disobedience
that he may have mercy upon all
he alone is God and that human destiny is in his hands
he has found the way... to condemn us into everlasting redemption
freedom from sin, freedom from guilt
God is both just and merciful
world of sinners for whom Christ died
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly placed in the position of the Receiver (the one who 'has it coming').

tekstueel_bewijs: through our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ
the Crucifixion of the Son of God remains the unique and central feature
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who uses the Cross as the instrument of salvation.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit; the Spirit is the one making the message 'liberating' to the soul.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / The illusion of righteousness / Human inability
tekstueel_bewijs: all that is wrong with us
the relentless struggle to think well of herself
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is presented as a universal 'consignment' from which no human can stand or escape by their own power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church/believer acknowledging their sin as a testimony to God's holiness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (confession/ethics) is a response to the primary program (God's judgment/mercy).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He may have mercy upon all
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We shall all stand before the judgment seat

voorbeelden: it is our Christian duty to see it
knowledge that God is both just and merciful
nothing that we can do to change that fact
no one could stand before him

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's sovereign 'pouvoir' (power to redeem).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (We all have it coming) to the negation of ~S1 (Religion/Righteousness) to the resolution in S1 (Everlasting Redemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'condemning' us into 'redemption'—merging the contrary terms through the Cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon insists no one escapes the whipping.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are the passive recipients of a mercy they cannot earn and a judgment they cannot avoid.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: it is our Christian duty to see [Schindler's List]

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all men... that he may have mercy
nothing — nothing — that we can do to change that fact

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Schindler is specifically used NOT as an example to follow, but as a 'Righteous Person' who likely felt his own unrighteousness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Schindler is a mirror for the hearer's own inadequacy.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the 'relentless struggle' of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; grace is a 'charter' given, not a goal achieved.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative engine (God's mercy) perfectly matches the rhetorical surface.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: world of sinners for whom Christ died

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father's decree and the Son's work than the Spirit's internal work.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; it 'puts religion out of business'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict Greimassian structure where God is the Subject and humanity is the Receiver of an Object (Mercy) they cannot produce.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Heavy on Pouvoir (God's power) and Non-Pouvoir (Man's inability).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Judgment) is already presented as an inescapable 'whipping'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly grounds the response of the church (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics that refuses to turn the Gospel into a 'to-do' list.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the use of pop-culture (Clint Eastwood), semiotics reveals that Eastwood is used as a 'Sender' of the law that God fulfills.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond explaining Romans 11 to showing how the 'actantial engine' of the text is mirrored in the sermon's own structure.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'liberation' felt by the hearer comes from being moved from the 'Subject' position (trying to be righteous) to the 'Receiver' position (being declared righteous).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God is merely an assistant to human effort.
